001package imagingbook.lib.math.eigen;
002
003
004/**
005 * Interface for classes performing eigenvalue/eigenvector calculations.
006 *
007 */
008public interface RealEigensolver {
009        
010        /**
011         * Returns the size of the system (N = number of rows and columns).
012         * @return size of the system (N)
013         */
014        public int getSize();
015        
016        /**
017         * Returns {@code true} iff all eigenvalues of the associated matrix are real.
018         * @return as described
019         */
020        public boolean isReal();
021        
022        /**
023         * Returns a vector of eigenvalues, sorted by magnitude (in descending order),
024         * i.e. |&lambda;<sub>0</sub>| &ge; |&lambda;<sub>1</sub>| &ge; ... &ge; |&lambda;<sub>N-1</sub>| for 
025         * all &lambda;<sub>k</sub> &ne; NaN.
026         * {@code NaN} is inserted for complex eigenvalues.
027         * @return an array of eigenvalues
028         */
029        public double[] getEigenvalues();
030        
031        /**
032         * Returns the k-th eigenvalue (&lambda;_k, for k = 0,...,N-1).
033         * Eigenvalues are sorted by magnitude (in descending order).
034         * {@code NaN} is returned if the associated eigenvalue
035         * is complex-valued (non-real).
036         * @param k index 
037         * @return the k-th eigenvalue (&lambda;<sub>k</sub>)
038         */
039        public double getEigenvalue(int k);
040        
041        /**
042         * Returns the k-th eigenvector.
043         * The ordering of the returned eigenvectors is the same as for the
044         * eigenvalues returned by {@link #getEigenvalues()}.
045         * @param k index
046         * @return the k-th eigenvector (x<sub>k</sub>)
047         */
048        public double[] getEigenvector(int k);
049
050}
